title: Cancer-stricken Olivia Newton-John, 71, is joined by husband and daughter at Wellness Walk
text:
She's the Australian icon who is battling cancer for a third time.

And on Sunday, Olivia Newton-John, 71, stepped out at her annual Wellness Walk and Research Run in Melbourne, which aims to raise funds for people with cancer.

The Grease star was joined on the day by her husband John Easterling - who she shared a smooch with - and her daughter Chloe Lattanzi, 33.

Her biggest supporters! Cancer-stricken Olivia Newton-John, 71, shared a smooch with husband John Easterling and was joined by daughter Chloe Lattanzi at her Wellness Walk and Research Run in Melbourne on Sunday

Pucker up! Olivia shared a sweet kiss with her man on the day

On the day, Olivia cut a stylish figure in her activewear.

She wore a white T-shirt and trousers with white runners, and a green and white jacket.

She wore her blonde locks out and over her shoulders and light, natural-looking makeup.

On the move! On the day, Olivia cut a stylish figure in her activewear

Quality time: Olivia looked in high spirits as she completed the walk with participants and at one point hugged Chloe

Brave: Last month, Olivia opened up about her battle with breast cancer, which she has for the third time, saying she vows to fight the disease

Chloe put her trim figure on show in khaki tights and a white cropped singlet.

Olivia looked in high spirits as she completed the walk with participants and at one point hugged Chloe.

Last month, Olivia opened up about her battle with breast cancer, which she has for the third time, saying she vows to fight the disease.

'I'm happy. I'm lucky. I'm grateful. I have much to live for. And I intend to keep on livin' it,' Olivia said in an interview with CBS This Morning.

Keeping positive: 'I'm happy. I'm lucky. I'm grateful. I have much to live for. And I intend to keep on livin' it,' Olivia said in an interview with CBS This Morning

Her battle: Olivia has stage four cancer and was diagnosed in 2017. She's also battled breast cancer in 1992 and 2013

Olivia has stage four cancer and was diagnosed in 2017. She's also battled breast cancer in 1992 and 2013.

Although the cancer keeps recurring during multiple stages of the actress' life, she said she felt no anger about the diagnosis.

'No. "Why me,'' has never been a part of it,' Olivia said.

'But I never felt victimised... Maybe deep down I knew there was a reason or a purpose for it, or maybe I needed to create one to make it OK for myself. Because it's — again, it's a decision, ''how am I gonna deal with it?''

Olivia has been a big proponent of using medical marijuana to help relieve some of the pain she's experienced when fighting the cancer. A route, she says, that helped improve her quality of life.
description: She's the Australian icon who is battling cancer for a third time.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
